message.content:
cs.NI, cs.GT, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.DC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with wireless resource management in cellular networks, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
2. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) - The paper proposes an optimization algorithm to minimize power consumption while satisfying quality of service requirements, which can be viewed as a game between the BSs and the grid. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a two-stage dynamic programming algorithm to optimize the BSs' on-off states and resource allocation, which can be viewed as a control problem. 
4. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with the allocation of resources (subcarriers) to minimize power consumption, which is related to information theory. 
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a distributed algorithm where each BS makes decisions based on statistical information, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
